alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Lac qui Parle and Chippewa Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers as additional rainfall from tonight and into Friday will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Montevideo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Sanitary sewers begin to be affected at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Thursday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 17.5 feet next Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.6 feet on 03/29/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chippewa; Lac qui Parle; Yellow Medicine
